name: Lekki Conservation Centre
address: Km 19 Lekki-Epe Expressway, Lekki Peninsula II, Lekki, Lagos State
description: A large nature reserve (≈78 hectares) run by the Nigerian Conservation Foundation. It's great for nature walks, bird watching, and the canopy walk—one of the longest in Africa—offering a thrilling view above the trees.

name: Tarkwa Bay Beach
address: Accessible only by boat from Marina (CMS), Tarzan Marine (Victoria Island), or Mekwe Jetty, Lagos Harbour
description: A relaxing island beach great for swimming, sunbathing, beach games, surfing, and chilling by the water. Offers a peaceful escape from the busy city.

name: New Afrika Shrine
address: 1 NERDC Road, Agidingbi, Alausa, Ikeja, Lagos
description: A cultural and music venue built as a successor to Fela Kuti's original Shrine. Known for Afrobeat performances, vibrant atmosphere, and great food and drinks.

name: Freedom Park Lagos
address: Old Prison Ground, Broad Street, Lagos Island, Lagos State
description: A former colonial prison turned into a cultural and recreational park. Features art installations, food courts, live performances, and historical monuments.

name: Nike Art Gallery
address: 2 Elegushi Road, 3rd Roundabout, Lekki Phase 1, Lagos State
description: One of the largest art galleries in West Africa, showcasing traditional and contemporary Nigerian artworks, textiles, and sculptures.

name: Hi-Impact Amusement Park
address: Km 12 Lagos-Ibadan Expressway, Ibafo (outskirts of Lagos)
description: A modern amusement and resort park featuring thrilling rides, arcade games, cinemas, restaurants, and outdoor entertainment suitable for families and friends.

name: Zen Archery
description: A fun and unique activity for individuals or small groups to learn and practice archery with professional guidance.

name: Upside Down House Lagos
description: A quirky photo attraction where furniture and décor are installed upside down for creative and fun pictures.
